entry.title: [uia] Culture property being incorrectly exposed on UIA
entry.content:
This CL fixes an issue on UIA where if there was a element with

a lang attribute specified, UIA would not get this specified value as

the computed Culture property.



This would happen since internally we were looking at the kStaticText's

first parent with a kLanguage string attribute. However, since the

kGenericContainer that has the string attribute is marked as ignored,

we end up getting the incorrect language attribute as we would skip

that generic container.



For the fix, we simply use the already existing logic



when it's specified on the ignored parent.



AXNode: :GetLanguage() which correctly computes the language, even

Change-Id: I68d344c83e8fa269fe7c8b4067d18a9b8c3e6774

entry.title: [PEPC] Rework the priority queue to always put PEPC requests first
entry.content:
Define a 3rd type of priority for requests to corresponds to PEPC requests.



In order to simplify the complicated logic on the queue, reworked it

to always be front-to-back. `Pop` and `Peek` will always return the front request. The `Push` function will decide whether to push requests to the front or back instead.



Rework the PRM logic that decides the current request fate to always

allow PEPC requests to preempt the current request (if it's not also a

PEPC request).



Bug: 1462930

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=alexmos@chromium.org



Bug: 1491463

Change-Id: Ia634e0f61d72117bc1c85976b62cd1aa807863f5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4943774

Reviewed-by: Alex Moshchuk

Commit-Queue: Alex Moshchuk

Auto-Submit: Alexei Svitkine

entry.title: view-transition: DCHECK at-rule not used in UA styles
entry.content:
@view-transitions is currently unimplemented when used from a UA

stylesheet. It would have to be added to

StyleEngine::ApplyUserRuleSetChanges (and possibly elsewhere) to make it

work.



However, since we don't currently need it it's simpler to leave this

as-is. This CL removes some TODOs and adds a DCHECK so that someone

adding the view-transitions at-rule to the UA stylesheet will know it

isn't implemented, rather than having it silently fail.

entry.title: SimpleCache: fix crash w/iterator entry doom concurrent w/bulk doom
entry.content:
The trouble was that entries opened via hash were not kept track of in active_entries_ until the open succeeded, and so the usual rules of letting an entry object take care of its own doom if it is around was not followed if a mass doom happened in that window.



So change the code to add the fresh entry to active_entries_ during open-by-hash just as it would be during a regular open. This does mean that active_entries_ sometimes has entries that don't have their key set yet, so the key in SimpleEntryImpl and SimpleSynchronousEntry was changed to be explicitly an optional, to make sure we never get confused --- it should be set by the time it's every user-visible, but now there will be angry absl::optional CHECKs if we screw up. (This also can avoid some confusion between empty key and key not set).

entry.title: [Fast Pair] Delay companion app notifications to avoid toast collision
entry.content:
Fast pair companion app notifications are delayed for ~6 seconds to

allow the Bluetooth device-connected toasts to auto-dismiss before the

notifications are shown.



Fast-pairing multiple devices with companion apps in quick succession

may cause the companion app notifications for prior devices to not

appear. If such a device is immediately disconnected after fast pair,

the companion app notification may still appear.



TESTED: Manually verified that the notification appears roughly when the

toast auto-dismisses. Updated some tests to allow for the delay.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Not adding tests for preexisting methods in FastPairPresenter.

entry.title: Correct output clip of scrollbar effect nodes
entry.content:
The output clip should be the parent of the current clip (the overflow

clip). Scrollbars are not clipped by the overflow clip. This didn't

cause any visible problem because we ignore the clip when we see the

PaintChunk of the scrollbar escapes the current effect's output clip,

but that caused annoying DLOG(ERROR) in PaintChunksToCcLayer for

in abnormal situation.



The incorrect output clip was added in crrev.com/1164980.

entry.title: [Autofill] Merge {Preview,Fill}FieldWithValue()
entry.content:
This CL merges the mojo messages {Preview,Fill}FieldWithValue()

into a single message that has an AutofillActionPersistence

(i.e., kPreview or kFill) parameter.



To make naming consistent, there are now two mojo messages:

- ApplyFormAction() is the new name of ApplyAutofillAction(),

formerly named FillOrPreviewForm().

- ApplyFieldAction() is the name of the merge of

{Preview,Fill}FieldWithValue().



Since ApplyFieldAction() also has an AutofillActionPersistence

parameter, its now just named ActionPersistence.



And therefore AutofillActionType is now named ActionType. This

is a bit risky w.r.t. naming collisions.



The only functional change is that now

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=boliu@chromium.org



Bug: 1491463

Change-Id: Iee87bb6dacb73bd780eae46322fa34ce78991953

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4943313

entry.title: Close single-display toasts when their root window is destroyed
entry.content:
Close the toast widget after the root window it exists in has been

removed and it does not show in other root windows.



This is a speculative fix for a crash that occurs on toast bounds

updated, possibly because the cached toast's root window does not exist

anymore.



Rename `OnClosed` to `CloseToast`, since the function is responsible

for destroying the toast's overlay widget.

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=wangxianzhu@chromium.org

entry.title: snap-groups: Move `SwapWindows()` to SnapGroup
entry.content:
This moves `SwapWindows()` from SplitViewController to SnapGroup, and

instead of breaking and recreating the group, simply swaps the windows

in the group. This is needed since SnapGroupController will either

start partial overview or add a snap group in `OnWindowSnapped()`, but

should do neither during a swap.



Note that since the group was previously broken, the divider was also

broken and recreated, which reset the expanded menu. The expanded menu

will now persist after the swap button is pressed.



Test: existing

Fixed: b/305066085

entry.title: [3PCD] Fix data flow for Tracking Protection 3PCD site info bubble
entry.content:
See go/3pcd-ub-site-info-architecture for context. Architecture for site

info was implemented via option (1) in the doc and this is not scaling

well to the UserBypass updates needed for 3PCD (which we need to implement within the next 2 days). The logic that was added before a)

doesn't share any data across site info/UB and b) isn't captured in

CookieControlsController::Status, which should contain all data

needed to render cookies UI, regardless of blocking state or 3PCD status



The bulk of the CL is a much-needed refactor of SetThirdPartyCookiesInfo

in page_info_cookies_content_view.cc. What was previously a 125-line function has had two large chunks of branching logic factored out,

reducing it to 40 lines with separate functions for constructing the

bubble's title/description and the 3PC toggle.

was chosen so that at 1000px, there's enough space for 680px content

earlier in the build so that the without patch isolates are ready by

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointer in TreeView's internal data structure.

in which each InternalNode keeps a reference to its corresponding

dangling pointers.

entry.content:
This CL adds only the "Fill full name" and the "Fill full address"

granular filling labels logic.



notes:

the space size based on chrome layout, therefore, simply appending it

to another label and manually add a space does not always work and

can lead to a discrepancy.

row. This is obsolete as was only added as a way to "guard" the UI.

see [2] and [3]

entry.title: Add IsCurrentInteraction computation + UKM metric for RedirectHeuristic.
entry.content:
Currently this is only used when recording a UKM event on cookie access, but when the heuristic actually creates storage access grants, it will be read when the redirect chain finishes (and we can confirm an A-B-A chain).



We already store interaction times in the DIPS db, but reading those is suboptimal here - they are sampled by kTimestampUpdateInterval, and the DIPS db isn't guaranteed to update immediately.



New UKM metric review: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dogmwtbUU0MEwL5RKICv47Ly_RnxBJhRuJHvMwsKrqs/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: mb: Ignore the goma warning when isolating a test's inputs
entry.content:
When running any gn command in a dir that has use_goma=true, gn prints

a warning to stdout about the arg being deprecated. That makes the

'gn desc' command mb.py uses to generate the isolate file think that

that deprecation warning is a file needed to isolate, eg:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BB9VodgbaFkkMBB



It'd be best if the deprecation warning was printed to stderr instead

of stdout, but gn doesn't seem to support that: https://crbug.com/gn/350



So this just looks for the warning in mb.py, and ignores it if it

sees it.

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=sky@chromium.org

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointers in LabelButton test.
entry.content:
To avoid dangling pointers, this CL does the following:

- It calls ExtractAsDangling on raw pointers to widget before calling

Widget::CloseNow(), since CloseNow() will trigger destruction.

- It replaces pointers to views with getters that obtain the views

by searching for them by ID in the ContentsView of the widget.



All the other changes in the file are due to replacing members by

getters, mostly button_ -> button().

entry.content:
We see that the R/W lock really helps Windows, but regresses

other platforms.



This is intended to merge to 119 to avoid the perf regression on

those platform from reaching stable.

additional improvements have landed. So once this is merged to

119, we can re-enable it again.

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointer in ProgressBar unit test.
entry.content:
This CL replaces a member variable to the progress bar that is being

tested by a getter that obtains it as the ContentsView of the widget.



It also removes a superfluous EventGenerator.
